description: Total number of split graphs (chordal + chordal complement) on n vertices.
comments: Also number of bipartite graphs with n vertices and no isolated vertices in distinguished bipartite block, up to isomorphism; so a(n) equals first differences of A049312. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jun 17 2000All split graphs are perfect. - _Falk Hüffner_, Nov 29 2015
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..40
B. A. Chat, S. Pirzada, A. Iványi, Recognition of split-graphic sequences, Acta Universitatis Sapientiae, Informatica, 6, 2 (2014) 252-286.
S. Hougardy, Classes of perfect graphs, Discr. Math. 306 (2006), 2529-2571.
Vladeta Jovovic, Binary matrices up to row and column permutations.
Gordon F. Royle, Counting set covers and split graphs, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 3 (2000), #00.2.6.
Index entries for sequences related to posets
crossrefs: Detlef Pauly remarks that this is the unlabeled analog of A001831.
author: _Gordon F. Royle_
